# Luigi Container API

This document outlines the parameters provided by the Luigi Container.<br/>
In addition you can use standard `addEventListener` function to react on events emmitted by the Luigi Container. The list of events and their meaning can be found [here](https://docs.luigi-project.io/docs/luigi-container-events).

## API Reference

<!-- Generated by jsdoc2md - update content below by updating the source code. -->

### new LuigiContainer()&nbsp;  
<p>Base class for Luigi container.</p>

### viewurl&nbsp;  
<p>The URL of the microfrontend to be rendered. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String">String</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html"></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.viewurl = "/index.html"
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.0.0
### deferInit&nbsp;  
<p>If set to true defers from initializing the microfronted automatically. In that case init() can be used. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean">Boolean</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" defer-init></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.deferInit = true
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.0.0
### context&nbsp;  
<p>The stringified context object to be passed to the microfrontend. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String">String</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" context='{"label": "Dashboard"}'></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.context = {label: "Dashboard"}
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.0.0
### label&nbsp;  
<p>Label information for the microfrontend. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String">String</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" label="Dashboard"></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.label = "Dashboard"
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.0.0
### webcomponent&nbsp;  
<p>Predicate that sets whether the microfrontend is to be rendered in a web component or not. It can also be an object with the attributes shown in a table below.</p>
<blockquote class="warning">
<p><strong>Note:</strong> If you have to use the mechanism of `selfRegistered`, we recommend using the following code in your web component:</p>
</blockquote>
<pre><code>window.Luigi._registerWebcomponent(new URL(document.currentScript?.getAttribute('src'), location), <YOUR_WEBCOMPONENT_CLASS>);</code></pre>
The advantage of this line of code is: you don't have to specify a tag name, thus avoiding the duplication of self-defined tag names. <br><br>
Type: `Boolean` or `WebComponentSettings` or `String`


| Param | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| specifies | <code>boolean</code> | <p>if a microfrontend is a webcomponent or not without any other settings</p> |
| [WebComponentSettings] | <code>Object</code> | <p>specifies that the microfrontend is a webcomponent with addtional settings</p> |
| WebComponentSettings.type | <code>string</code> | <p>a string, like module</p> |
| WebComponentSettings.selfRegistered | <code>boolean</code> | <p>if it is true, the web component bundle will be added via script tag</p> |
| WebComponentSettings.tagName | <code>string</code> | <p>tag name where web component is added to DOM</p> |
| string | <code>string</code> | <p>must be a stringified boolean or JSON object from type <code>WebComponentSettings</code></p> |

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container webcomponent="{ type: 'module', selfRegistered: true, tagName: 'my-webcomponent'}"></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.webcomponent = { type: 'module', selfRegistered: true, tagName: 'my-webcomponent'}
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.0.0
### locale&nbsp;  
<p>The locale to be passed to the web-component-based micro frontend. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String">String</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container locale="en_us"></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.locale = "en_us"
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.0.0
### theme&nbsp;  
<p>The theme to be passed to the  web-component-based micro frontend. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String">String</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" theme='sap_horizon'></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.theme = 'sap_horizon'
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.0.0
### activeFeatureToggleList&nbsp;  
<p>The list of active feature toggles to be passed to the web-component-based micro frontend. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array">Array</a>&lt;<a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String">string</a>&gt;</p>

**Example**  
```js
myContainer.activeFeatureToggleList = ["enable-foo", "allow-bar"]
```
**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" active-feature-toggle-list='["enable-foo", "allow-bar"]'></luigi-container>
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.0.0
### skipCookieCheck&nbsp;  
<p>If set to true, skips third party cookie check. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean">Boolean</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" skipCookieCheck></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.skipCookieCheck = true
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.4.0
### skipInitCheck&nbsp;  
<p>If set to true, skips handshake and ready event is fired immediately. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean">Boolean</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" skipInitCheck></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.skipInitCheck = true
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.0.0
### nodeParams&nbsp;  
<p>The parameters to be passed to the web-component-based micro frontend. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object">Object</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" node-params='{"node":"param"}'></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.nodeParams = {foo: bar}
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.0.0
### noShadow&nbsp;  
<p>If set to true, the Luigi container webcomponent will not use the shadow DOM for rendering. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean">Boolean</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" no-shadow></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.noShadow = true
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.2.0
### searchParams&nbsp;  
<p>The search parameters to be passed to the web-component-based micro frontend. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object">Object</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" search-params='{"search":"param"}'></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.searchParams = {foo: bar}
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.0.0
### pathParams&nbsp;  
<p>The path parameters to be passed to the web-component-based micro frontend. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object">Object</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" path-params='{"path":"param"}'></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.pathParams = {foo: "bar"}
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.0.0
### clientPermissions&nbsp;  
<p>The clientPermissions to be passed to the web-component-based micro frontend. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object">Object</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" client-permissions='{"permission": "adminGroup"}'></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.clientPermissions = {permission: "adminGroup"}
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.0.0
### userSettings&nbsp;  
<p>The user settings to be passed to the web-component-based micro frontend. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object">Object</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" user-settings='{"language": "de", "theme":"sap_horizon"}'></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.userSettings = {language: 'de', theme: 'sap_horizon'}
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.0.0
### anchor&nbsp;  
<p>The anchor value to be passed to the web-component-based micro frontend. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String">String</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" anchor='#foo'></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.anchor = '#foo'
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.0.0
### allowRules&nbsp;  
<p>The list of rules for the content in the iframe, managed by the HTML <code>allow</code> attribute.
You can use one or more rules by adding them to the array, for example allowRules: [&quot;microphone&quot;, &quot;camera&quot;]. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array">Array</a>&lt;<a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String">string</a>&gt;</p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" allow-rules='["microphone", "camera"]'></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
containerElement.allowRules = ['microphone', 'camera']
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.2.0
### sandboxRules&nbsp;  
<p>The list of rules for the content in the iframe, managed by the HTML <code>sandbox</code> attribute.
You can use one or more rules by adding them to the array, for example sandboxRules: [&quot;allow-scripts&quot;, &quot;allow-same-origin&quot;]. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array">Array</a>&lt;<a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String">string</a>&gt;</p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" sandbox-rules='["allow-scripts", "allow-same-origin"]'></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
containerElement.sandboxRules = ['allow-modals', 'allow-popups']
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.2.0
### documentTitle&nbsp;  
<p>The document title value to be passed to the web-component-based micro frontend. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String">String</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" document-title='Luigi App'></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.documentTitle = 'Luigi App'
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.2.0
### hasBack&nbsp;  
<p>The hasBack value to be passed to the web-component-based micro frontend.
It indicates that there is one or more preserved views. Useful when you need to show a back button. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean">Boolean</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" has-back></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.hasBack = true
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.2.0
### dirtyStatus&nbsp;  
<p>The dirty status value to be passed to the web-component-based micro frontend.
It's used to indicate that there are unsaved changes when navigating away. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean">Boolean</a></p>

**Example**  
```js
<luigi-container viewurl="/index.html" dirty-status></luigi-container>
```
**Example**  
```js
myContainer.dirtyStatus = true
```
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.2.0
### authData&nbsp;  
<p>The authData value to be passed to the iframe-based micro frontend. <br><br>
Type: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object">Object</a></p>

  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.2.0
### updateContext&nbsp;  
<p>Function that updates the context of the microfrontend.</p>


| Param | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| contextObj | <code>Object</code> | <p>the context data</p> |
| internal | <code>Object</code> | <p>internal luigi legacy data used for iframes</p> |

**Example**  
```js
containerElement.updateContext({newContextData: 'some data'})
```
**Returns**: <code>void</code> - <p>no explicit return type</p>  
  
**Meta**:  
* **since:** 1.0.0
